description:
In this role, you'll work to scale our online strategy and programs for Google Cloud. You’ll be responsible for bringing traffic to Google Cloud’s websites. You’ll identify and size organic growth opportunities and drive execution.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in online/website growth and content strategy for organic search optimization (SEO), product management, research or insight generation.
  • 2 years of experience in marketing and offering B2B cloud computing products/services to developers and business leaders.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to collaborate and work with internal stakeholders and leverage external agencies or vendors to deliver project outputs.
  • Ability to solve problems independently and with an innovative approach.
  • Excellent project management skills, with the ability to prioritize, sequence, execute and deliver projects on time and on budget.
  • Demonstrated critical thinking skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders and represent the team internally and externally.
responsibilities:
• Drive organic growth of Google Cloud products online.
  • Develop strategies to capitalize on growth opportunities and increase Google Cloud’s footprint in search and other non-paid online sources.
  • Build programs to create and deploy search-focused content in a scalable way.
  • Observe the performance of executed work against growth goals, and provide a feedback mechanism that creates a culture of continual improvement.
  • Prioritize impactful opportunities, identify the resources needed to execute successfully, and lead delivery to achieve desired outcomes. Partner with research, product marketing, product management, creative, and engineering teams to ensure execution aligns with strategy.
title: Marketing Manager, Organic Growth, Google Cloud
